rundown: 6-1 W vs Philadelphia Phillies Spencer Schwellenbach: 7.0 innings, 1 earned run, 3 hits, 0 HR, 12 strikeouts Batters: Sean Murphy (2 hits - 4 AB, 1 HR, 4 RBI) Nick Allen (2 hits - 4 AB, 0 HR, 1 RBI) Austin Riley (2 hits - 4 AB, 0 HR, 1 RBI) The Braves secured a convincing victory over the Philadelphia Phillies, showcasing a dominant performance both on the mound and at the plate. Spencer Schwellenbach led the charge with an impressive 12 strikeouts, allowing only 3 hits and 1 earned run over 7 innings. Key highlights include: 1. Sean Murphy's standout game, hitting a home run and driving in 4 runs. 2. The Braves' offense was relentless, accumulating a total of 13 hits. 3. Schwellenbach's strikeout prowess kept the Phillies' batters off balance throughout the game.
